title: Cylinder Liner - Removal

body.body: You will need two sets of
to remove the cylinder liner assembly.
Turn the crankshaft until the pistons number one and three are at the middle point of their stroke.
Check that the locking nuts on each
are loose, then gradually fully unscrew the extraction nut on each tool.

Carefully fit one tool fully into cylinder bore number one, positioning the tool legs on the crankcase. Turn the locking nut clockwise until the rubber sleeve on the tool tightly grips the bore of the liner.
Repeat step 4 with the second tool into cylinder bore number three.
Check that the tool legs are positioned to allow withdrawal of the liner.
Turn the two extraction nuts clockwise in alternate steps to evenly extract the liner.
Take care to make sure that the piston/connecting rods do not fall against the crankcase when you install or remove them from the liner assembly.
The pistons can be easily damaged if they hit the crankcases.
The tools must be used to release the seal between the liner and the crankcase.
It is not intended that the tools are used to fully extract the liner. Once the seal is released, the tools must be removed and the liner extracted by hand.
Turn the locking nuts anticlockwise to release the tools from the liner.

service tool T3880315
to remove the cylinder liner assembly.
Assemble the two sets of
service tool T3880315

are loose, then gradually fully unscrew the extraction nut on each tool.

Locking nuts
Repeat step 4 with the second tool into cylinder bore number three.
Check that the tool legs are positioned to allow withdrawal of the liner.
Turn the two extraction nuts clockwise in alternate steps to evenly extract the liner.
Take care to make sure that the piston/connecting rods do not fall against the crankcase when you install or remove them from the liner assembly.
The pistons can be easily damaged if they hit the crankcases.
The tools must be used to release the seal between the liner and the crankcase.
It is not intended that the tools are used to fully extract the liner. Once the seal is released, the tools must be removed and the liner extracted by hand.
Turn the locking nuts anticlockwise to release the tools from the liner.
